alert.note: Alert for Cecil (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued December 23 at 10:59AM EST until December 23 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Up to one half foot of inundation above ground level in low lying areas due to tidal flooding. * WHERE...Shoreline in Cecil County. * WHEN...Until 1 PM EST this afternoon, especially around the time of high tide. * IMPACTS...At 5.5 feet, minor shoreline flooding begins near Chesapeake City. At 4.5 feet, minor shoreline flooding begins near Charlestown. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Tides up to 4 feet above normal. The next high tide at Charlestown is at 10:29 PM and 10:25 AM. The next high tide at Port Deposit is at 10:01 PM and 9:57 AM. The next high tide at Chesapeake City is at 10:24 PM and 10:57 AM.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
